question: Question_05_(b)
statement:
A carrot has the shape formed by revolving the region under the graph of

\[f(x) = \sqrt{14-x}\]

for $0 \leq x \leq 12$ cm about the \emph{x} axis. The concentration of
vitamin A is found to vary in the carrot with \emph{x} according to

\[c(x) = \frac1{12} e^{-x/12} \frac{\text{mg}}{\text{cm}^3}\]

\begin{figure}[htbp]
\centering
\includegraphics[width=.5\textwidth]{Math_Exam_Resources_Courses_MATH103_April_2009_Question_5_(a)_5a.png}
\caption{Math\_Exam\_Resources\_Courses\_MATH103\_April\_2009\_Question\_5\_(a)\_5a.png}
\end{figure}

What is the total amount of vitamin A in the carrot?
sols:
To find the amount \emph{A} of Vitamin A in the carrot, we need to
multiply every infinitly small disk with unit $cm^3$ with the passend
concentration of Vitamin A and then integrate over all disks:

\begin{align*}
A &= \int_0^{12}\frac{1}{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\left(\sqrt{14-x}\right)^2\pi dx \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12}\int_0^{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}(14-x)dx\\
 &= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \int_0^{12}xe^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx\right]
\end{align*}

We let the former integral as is for now and use integration by parts
for the latter. Let \emph{u = x}, \emph{du} = \emph{dx}, \emph{dv} =
\emph{e}\textsuperscript{-\emph{x}/12}\emph{dx} and v =
-12\emph{e}\textsuperscript{-\emph{x}/12}. Then

\begin{align*}
A &= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \int_0^{12}xe^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12}\left[\int_0^{12}14e^{-\frac{x}{12}}dx - \left(\left.x(-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\right|_0^{12} - \int_0^{12} (-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx\right)\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[ 14\int_0^{12} e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx - 12\int_0^{12}e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx+(12)(12)e^{-1}-0\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[ 2\int_0^{12} e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\,dx + (12)(12)e^{-1}\right] \\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[\left. 2(-12)e^{-\frac{x}{12}}\right|_0^{12} + (12)(12)e^{-1}\right]\\
&= \frac{\pi}{12} \left[-2(12)(e^{-1}-1)+(12)(12)e^{-1}\right] \\
&= \pi\left[-2e^{-1}+2+12e^{-1}\right] \\
&= \pi\left[\frac{10}{e}+2\right] \\
&= \frac{2\pi(5+e)}{e}.
\end{align*}
hints:
The amount of Vitamin A is

\texttt{concentration~x~volume.}

You need to multiply the concentration and the disk-volume for every
infinitly small disk and then integrate over all disks.
